   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   29: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   30: 	 get_plain_arguments/1,
   31: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   32:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1,
   33: 	 find_system_processes/0]).
   34: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   37: 
   38: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   39: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   40: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   41: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   42: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   43: suite() ->
   44:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   45:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   46: 
   47: all() -> 
   48:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   49:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   50:      get_plain_arguments, restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   51:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot}].
   52: 
   53: groups() -> 
   54:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   55: 
   56: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: 
   69: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   76:     Args = args(),
   77:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   78:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   79: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   80: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   81: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   82: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   83: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   84: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   85: 	_ ->
   86:             peer:stop(Peer),
   87: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   88:     end,
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: check_a(Args) ->
   92:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   93: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
   94: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
   95: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
   96: 		false ->
   97: 		    ok;
   98: 		_ ->
   99: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  100: 	    end;
  101: 	_ ->
  102: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  103:     end.
  104: 
  105: check_b(Args) ->
  106:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  107: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  108: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  109: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  110: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  111: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  112: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  113: 			false ->
  114: 			    ok;
  115: 			_ ->
  116: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  117: 		    end;
  118: 		_ ->
  119: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  120: 	    end;
  121: 	_ ->
  122: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  123:     end.
  124: 
  125: check_c(Args) ->
  126:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  127: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  128: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  129: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  130: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  131: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  132: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  133: 			false ->
  134: 			    ok;
  135: 			_ ->
  136: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  137: 		    end;
  138: 		_ ->
  139: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  140: 	    end;
  141: 	_ ->
  142: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  143:     end.
  144: 
  145: check_d(Args) ->
  146:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  147: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  148: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  149: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  150: 		false ->
  151: 		    ok;
  152: 		_ ->
  153: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  154: 	    end;
  155: 	_ ->
  156: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  157:     end.
  158: 
  159: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     Args = args(),
  161:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  162:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  163: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  164: 	    ok;
  165: 	_ ->
  166: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  167: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  168:     end,
  169:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  170: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  171: 	    ok;
  172: 	_ ->
  173: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  174: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  175:     end,
  176:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  177: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  178: 	    ok;
  179: 	_ ->
  180: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  181: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  182:     end,
  183:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  184: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  185: 	    ok;
  186: 	_ ->
  187: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  188: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  189:     end,
  190:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  191: 	error ->
  192: 	    ok;
  193: 	_ ->
  194: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  195: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  196:     end,
  197:     peer:stop(Peer),
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     Longstring = 
  202: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  203: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  204: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  205: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  206: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  207: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  211:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  212:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  213:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  214:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  215: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  216: 	    ok;
  217: 	As ->
  218: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  219: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  220:     end,
  221:     peer:stop(Peer),
  222: 
  223:     ok.
  224: 
  225: 
  226: %% ------------------------------------------------
  227: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  228: %% ------------------------------------------------
  229: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  231: 
  232:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  233:     try
  234:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  235:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  236:     catch
  237:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  238:             ok
  239:     end,
  240: 
  241: 
  242:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  243: 	true ->
  244: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  245: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  246: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  247: 	    Res = ok;
  248: 	_ ->
  249: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  250: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  251: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  252: 	    io:format(
  253: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  254: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  255: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  256: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  257: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  258: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  259: 	      []),
  260: 	    Res = {skip,
  261: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  262: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  263: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  264:     end,
  265:     Res.
  266: 
  267: create_boot(Config) ->
  268:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  269:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  270: 	create_script(Config),
  271:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  272:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  273:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  274: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  275:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  276:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  277: 
  278: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  279:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  280:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  281: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  282: 
  283: %% ------------------------------------------------
  284: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  285: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  286: %% before restart.
  287: %% ------------------------------------------------
  288: many_restarts() ->
  289:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  290: 
  291: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  293:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  294:     peer:stop(Peer),
  295:     ok.
  296: 
  297: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  298:     ok;
  299: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  300:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  301:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  302:     receive
  303: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  304: 	    ok
  305:     after 10000 ->
  306: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  307: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  308:     end,
  309:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  310:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  311: 
  312: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  313:     peer:stop(Peer),
  314:     error;
  315: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  316:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  317: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  318: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  319: 	    ok;
  320: 	_X ->
  321: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  322: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  323: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  324: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  325: 	    %%     true ->
  326: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  327: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  328: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  329: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  330: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  331: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  332: 	    %%     _ ->
  333: 	    %% 	  ok
  334: 	    %% end,
  335: 	    receive
  336: 	    after 100 ->
  337: 		    ok
  338: 	    end,
  339: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  340:     end.
  341: 
  342: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  344:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  345:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  346: 
  347:     Quote = case os:type() of
  348:                 {win32,_} ->
  349:                     [$"];
  350:                 {unix,_} ->
  351:                     [$']
  352:             end,
  353: 
  354:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  355:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  356:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  357: 
  358:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  359:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  360:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  361: 
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: %% ------------------------------------------------
  365: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  366: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  367: %% before restart.
  368: %% ------------------------------------------------
  369: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  370:     Args = args(),
  371:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  372:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  373:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  374:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  375:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  376:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  377:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  378:      PrimFilePid,
  379:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  380:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  381:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  382:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  383:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  384:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  385:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  386:     receive
  387: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  388: 	    ok
  389:     after 10000 ->
  390: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  391: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  392:     end,
  393:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  394: 
  395:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  396:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  397:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  398:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  399:      PrimFilePid1,
  400:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  401: 
  402:     %% Still the same init process!
  403:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  404:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  405:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  406: 
  407:     %% and same purger process!
  408:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  409:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  410:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  411: 
  412:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  413:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  414:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  415: 
  416:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  417:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  418:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  419:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  420:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  421:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  422:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  423:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  424:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  425: 
  426:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  427:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  428:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  429: 
  430:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  431:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  432:             %% No socket registry on either node
  433:             ok;
  434:        true ->
  435:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  436:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  437:     end,
  438: 
  439:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  440:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  441:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  442: 	true ->
  443: 	    ok;
  444: 	_ ->
  445: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  446: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  447:     end,
  448: 
  449:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  450:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  451: 
  452:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  453:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  454: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  455: 	    ok;
  456: 	_ ->
  457: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  458: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  459:     end,
  460:     peer:stop(Peer),
  461:     ok.
  462: 
  463: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  464: 		    code_purger,
  465: 		    literal_collector,
  466: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  467: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  468: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  469:                     prim_file,
  470:                     socket_registry}).
  471: 
  472: find_system_processes() ->
  473:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  474: 
  475: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  476:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  477:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  478:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  479:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  480:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  481:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  482:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  483:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  484: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  485:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  486: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  487: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  488: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  489: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  490: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  491: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  492: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  493: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  494: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  495: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  496:          {priority,normal}] ->
  497: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  498: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  499: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  500:                        {priority,high}] ->
  501: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  502: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  503: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  504:          {priority,max}] ->
  505: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  506: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  507:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  508: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  509: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  510:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  511: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  512: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  513: 	_ ->
  514: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  515:     end.
  516: 
  517: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  518:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  519: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  520:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  521: 	pong -> ok;
  522: 	_ -> 
  523: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  524: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  525:     end.
  526: 
  527: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  528:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  529:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  530: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  531: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  532: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  533: 				  _                      -> true
  534: 			      end
  535: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  536: 	[] ->
  537: 	    true;
  538: 	_  ->
  539: 	    false
  540:     end.
  541: 
  542: apid(Pid) ->
  543:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  544:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  545: 
  546: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  547:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  548:         {file,preloaded} ->
  549:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  550:         _ ->
  551:             ok
  552:     end.
  553: 
  554: %% ------------------------------------------------
  555: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  556: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  557: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  558: %% ------------------------------------------------
  559: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     Args = args(),
  561:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  562:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  563:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  564:     receive
  565: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  566: 	    ok
  567:     after 10000 ->
  568: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  569: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  570:     end,
  571:     ct:sleep(5000),
  572:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  573: 	pang ->
  574: 	    ok;
  575: 	_ ->
  576: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  577: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  578:     end,
  579:     ok.
  580: 
  581: %% ------------------------------------------------
  582: %%
  583: %% ------------------------------------------------
  584: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  586:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  587:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  588:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  589:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  590:     ok.
  591: 
  592: catch_stop(Status) ->
  593:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  594: 
  595: %% ------------------------------------------------
  596: %%
  597: %% ------------------------------------------------
  598: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     Args = args(),
  600:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  601:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  602:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  603:     receive
  604: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  605: 	    ok
  606:     after 10000 ->
  607: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  608: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  609:     end,
  610:     ct:sleep(5000),
  611:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  612: 	pang ->
  613: 	    ok;
  614: 	_ ->
  615: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  616: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  617:     end,
  618:     ok.
  619: 
  620: %% ------------------------------------------------
  621: %% 
  622: %% ------------------------------------------------
  623: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  624:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  625: 
  626:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  627:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  628:     %% -s flag.
  629:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  630: 	true ->
  631: 	    ok;
  632: 	_ ->
  633: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  634:     end.
  635: 
  636: %% ------------------------------------------------
  637: %% 
  638: %% ------------------------------------------------
  639: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  641:     if
  642: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  643: 	    ok;
  644: 	true ->
  645: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  646:     end,
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: %% ------------------------------------------------
  650: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  651: %% ------------------------------------------------
  652: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  653:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  654: 
  655:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  656:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  657: 
  658:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  659:                   {win32, _} ->
  660:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  661:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  662:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  663:                   _ ->
  664:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  665:               end,
  666: 
  667:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  668: 
  669:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  670:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  671:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  672:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  673: 
  674:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  675:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  676:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  677: 
  678:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  679: 
  680:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  681:     peer:stop(Peer),
  682: 
  683:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  684:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  685:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  686: 
  687:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  688:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  689: 
  690:     ok.
  691: 
  692: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  693:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  694:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  695:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  696:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  697:     ok.
  698: 
  699: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  700:     receive
  701:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  702:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  703:     after
  704:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  705:     end.
  706: 
  707: %% ------------------------------------------------
  708: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  709: %% ------------------------------------------------
  710: 
  711: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  713:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  714:     peer:stop(Peer),
  715: 
  716:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  717:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  718:     try
  719:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  720:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  721:     catch
  722:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  723:             ok
  724:     end.
  725: 
  726: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  727:     %% Absolute boot file name
  728:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  729: 
  730:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  731:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  732:     peer:stop(Peer),
  733: 
  734:     case os:type() of 
  735: 	{win32, _} ->
  736: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  737: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  738: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  739: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  740: 				     (C) -> C
  741: 				end, Boot),
  742: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  743: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  744: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  745: 	_ ->
  746: 	    ok
  747:     end,
  748: 
  749:     ok.
  750: 
  751: %% Misc. functions    
  752: 
  753: args() ->
  754:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  755:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  756: 
  757: long_args(A) ->
  758:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  759:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  760: 
  761: create_script(Config) ->
  762:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  763:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
  764:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
  765:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
  766:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
  767:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
  768:     io:format(Fd,
  769: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
  770: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
  771: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
  772: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
  773:     file:close(Fd),
  774:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
  775:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
  776:
